maml:description.maml:para: Loads an ISESteroids license file.
Supply the path to a valid ISESteroids license file to load and use this license. You can also copy a license file into the "License" subfolder inside the ISESteroids module folder.
Path to ISESteroids license file
Path to ISESteroids license file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Loads and activates the license file stored in c:\temp\newlicense.license

maml:description.maml:para: Adds an executable to the "Tools" menu.
Add 3rd party tools to the "Tools" menu. Run this cmdlet from your profile script. This way, the tools are added to the menu each time you launch ISESteroids.
Gets all breakpoints.
Returns a list of currently defined breakpoints.
returns the compatibility report for the currently opened script

creates and returns a detailed compatibility report for the currently open script. This report contains information about the minimum required PowerShell version, required modules/snapins, and references to the code that causes these requirements.
Returns a list of all ISESteroids keyboard shortcuts for commands.
Returns the performance data collected for the current script.

Performance data is collected when you enable script profiling. To enable script profiling, right-click the debugger margin, then choose "Profiling" / "Profile All Scripts". When you now run a script, ISESteroids displays a performance graph in the debugger margin, indicating how long each line of the script took to process. Once a script executed, you can use this cmdlet to dump the collected performance data.
returns a list of all code snippets.
Code snippets can be inserted by pressing CTRL+J. This cmdlet returns all code snippets and their settings.
The keyboard shortcut assigned to the code snippet.
The keyboard shortcut assigned to the code snippet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all code snippets and their settings.

returns the code snippet(s) with the keyboard shortcut 'for'. There can be multiple code snippets with the same keyboard shortcut. The Scope settings determine which code snippet will be active in a given scope. To insert a snippet with a keyboard shortcut, enter the keyboard shortcut, then press TAB.

maml:description.maml:para: returns a list of keyboard shortcuts defined for code snippets.
To insert a code snippet via keyboard shortcut, enter the keyboard shortcut, then press TAB. To see a list of valid snippet keyboard shortcuts, use this cmdlet.
Returns the ISESteroids version number.
Use this cmdlet to find out the current ISESteroids version number.
Assigns a new keyboard shortcut to an ISESteroids command
To change keyboard shortcuts and assign your own choice of keyboard shortcuts, use this cmdlet.
internal use
removes a keyboard shortcut for an ISESteroids command
This cmdlet removes a keyboard shortcut from an ISESteroids command
Remove the current ISESteroids license.
Removes the active license and returns ISESteroids to an unlicensed state. The license can then be used on another machine.
Opens the license dialog. This dialog shows licensing details and can remove the current license, or add a new license.

Use this cmdlet to inspect the current licensing settings. Click "Remove License" to immediately remove the current license from this machine. ISESteroids will return to unlicensed state, and the license can be used on a different machine.
Loads the ISESteroids extension

This cmdlet imports the ISESteroids module and loads the extension. While the ISE user interface is enhanced, the ISE window displays a blur. After a couple of seconds, the blur ends, and the ISE editor displays a multitude of new UI elements and functionality.
Adds a #requires statement to the current script, or updates an existing #requires statement. Available in ISESteroids PowerShell Specialist and ISESteroids Enterprise.

This cmdlet affects the currently opened script. If there is no script open, or if the current editor pane is empty, this cmdlet has no effect. The cmdlet adds or updates a #requires statement at the beginning of the script. This statement automatically sets the script requirements (minimum PowerShell version, required modules and/or snapins). This information is automatically derived from the script code. You can press CTRL+ALT+R to add/update the #requires statement as well.
Refreshes the internal snippet cache.
When you add new code snippets or load modules that add new snippets, run this cmdlet to refresh the ISE snippet cache.
